summary: An email from the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY discussing preparation of briefing memos on sensitive cases, including the Epstein case, for a meeting with the Attorney General scheduled for the following Monday.

persons.name: Chief Public Corruption Unit
persons.role: Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, SDNY
persons.context: The author of the email, coordinating the preparation of briefing memos on sensitive cases for the Attorney General.

connections.description: The Chief is preparing to brief the Attorney General on sensitive cases, including Epstein.

events.title: Meeting with the Attorney General
events.description: A scheduled meeting with the Attorney General to brief him on sensitive cases, including the Epstein case.

events.title: Briefing memos due to brass
events.description: Draft briefing memos on sensitive cases are to be delivered to senior officials (brass) by Thursday morning.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Epstein case was classified as a 'sensitive case' requiring a briefing for the Attorney General in February 2019.
The Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY was coordinating the preparation of detailed briefing memos on the Epstein case.
The briefing for the Attorney General was scheduled for a Monday, indicating high-level attention to the case.
